meanings.definition: A strip of fur or skin used as trimming or decoration.
meanings.sent1: The plews added a touch of elegance to the coat.
meanings.sent2: She sewed the plews onto the collar of the jacket.
meanings.sent3: The plews on the hat made it look fancy.
meanings.sent4: The plews were like little accents of luxury.
meanings.sent5: The soft plews felt luxurious against her skin.

meanings.definition: A bundle of animal skins or furs.
meanings.sent1: The hunter carried a heavy load of plews on his back.
meanings.sent2: The market was filled with colorful plews for sale.
meanings.sent3: The plews were stacked high, almost reaching the ceiling.
meanings.sent4: The plews resembled a cozy pile of blankets.
meanings.sent5: The plews smelled of the outdoors and animals.

meanings.definition: To strip the skin or fur from an animal.
meanings.sent1: She carefully plewsed the rabbit to prepare the fur.
meanings.sent2: The trapper plewsed the beaver to sell the pelts.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he could plews a bear in record time.
meanings.sent4: The skilled furrier plewsed the fox with precision.
meanings.sent5: The old method of plewsing animals is no longer used.
